page.title: 16 Proj.6 Ince Castle
page.content: {Ince Castle Long narrow lanes with high hedges lead away from the long busy main road to the secluded quiet place where Ince Castle stands.It is set in beautiful garden and grounds stretching down to the river and a private landing stage, and enjoys superb views across and down the Lyhner. In the garden a flock of white doves live in an unusual hexagonal dove cote , built over a tiny ground floor room with walls completely covered with shells of all shape and sizes and beautiful geological specimens set in colourful and intricate patterns designed by Lord and Lady Boyd who bought the property in 1960.Outside the front door is a huge Turkey oak about 200 years old,the favourite roost of the 3 white peacocks . -]
